intro: Artemisia frigida, commonly known as white sage, is a perennial herb native to North America. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and aromatic, aromatic leaves that emit a strong, pungent scent. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers in the summer, which are followed by small, fluffy seeds. Artemisia frigida is often used in traditional medicine and as a ceremonial plant due to its strong aromatic properties.
